question: What is a majority government?
possible_answers: A. The party in power holds at least half of the seats in the House of Commons and the Senate.
B. The party in power holds at least half of the seats in the House of Commons.
C. The party in power holds less than half of the seats in the House of Commons.
D. The party in power holds at least half of the seats in the Senate.
answer: B. The party in power holds at least half of the seats in the House of Commons.
explanatory_sentence: If the party in power holds at least half of the seats in the House of Commons, this is called a majority government.
